docs.snippet: The mogul doesn’t need validation on social media, but he does care what you think.
Hundreds of Times readers weighed in on the sexual harassment allegations against the star architect and the apology he gave in response.

headline.print_headline: Readers React to Misconduct Accusations Against Richard Meier
headline.main: Readers React to Misconduct Accusations Against Richard Meier

docs.snippet: After Nolan Ryan Trowe and Adhiambo Mitchell bonded over their shared disabilities, Mr. Trowe set out to photograph the busy life of his friend.

headline.print_headline: ‘It Was Like My Disability Became a Gift’
headline.main: ‘It Was Like My Disability Became a Gift’

docs.snippet: The latest on developments in financial markets (all times local):

headline.print_headline: Markets Right Now: Dow Surges 669, Clawing Back Lost Ground
headline.main: Markets Right Now: Dow Surges 669, Clawing Back Lost Ground

docs.snippet: The U.S. House Intelligence Committee voted along party lines on Thursday to adopt a Republican report on the panel's investigation of Russia and the 2016 U.S. election, formally ending a probe marred for months by bitter partisan conflict.

headline.print_headline: House Republicans Vote to Release Russia Report
headline.main: House Republicans Vote to Release Russia Report

docs.snippet: The 17-year-old, who became a Palestinian symbol of resistance but was then arrested and held without bail, accepted a plea bargain.

headline.print_headline: Ahed Tamimi, Palestinian Teen, Gets 8 Months in Prison for Slapping Israeli Soldier
headline.main: Ahed Tamimi, Palestinian Teen, Gets 8 Months in Prison for Slapping Israeli Soldier

docs.snippet: The U.S. Senate passed legislation on Wednesday aimed at penalizing website operators that facilitate online sex trafficking, chipping away at a bedrock legal shield for the technology industry.

headline.print_headline: Senate Passes Bill to Penalize Websites for Sex Trafficking
headline.main: Senate Passes Bill to Penalize Websites for Sex Trafficking

docs.snippet: European stocks recovered on Tuesday, led by banking stocks while tech stayed under pressure after concerns over increased regulation and taxation of large companies in the sector prompted selling overnight on Wall Street.

headline.print_headline: European Stocks Climb, Led by Banks as Telecoms Weigh
headline.main: European Stocks Climb, Led by Banks as Telecoms Weigh

docs.snippet: The turbulent home life of a North Carolina infant seen smoking pot on a viral video was evident Wednesday as a second person appeared in court on charges of giving her a marijuana blunt.

headline.print_headline: Second Person Charged With Helping Infant Smoke Marijuana
headline.main: Second Person Charged With Helping Infant Smoke Marijuana

docs.snippet: A 31-year-old man has been arrested and two men remain at large for burglarizing the Massachusetts home of New England Patriots star tight end Rob Gronkowski following the team's Super Bowl loss, police said.

headline.print_headline: Man Arrested for Burglarizing Patriots Gronkowski's Home
headline.main: Man Arrested for Burglarizing Patriots Gronkowski's Home
